qas.question: Along with light cavalry, what military arm was used with increasing frequency in the Late Middle Ages?
What troops were uniquely successful in English service?
What influenced the increasing development of armor?
What weapons were notably employed by the Swiss infantry?
Along with crossbows, what was plate armor designed to defend against?

context: One of the major developments in the military sphere during the Late Middle Ages was the increased use of <a0_0>infantry<a0_0/> and light cavalry. The English also employed <a1_0>longbowmen<a1_0/>, but other countries were unable to create similar forces with the same success. Armour continued to advance, spurred by <a2_0>the increasing power of crossbows<a2_0/>, and plate armour was developed to protect soldiers from crossbows as well as the <a4_0>hand-held guns<a4_0/> that were developed. Pole arms reached new prominence with the development of the Flemish and Swiss infantry armed with <a3_0>pikes<a3_0/> and other long spears.
